fuzzycontroller.rule package#

Modules#

fuzzycontroller.rule.propositions#

class fuzzycontroller.rule.propositions.Antecedent(ant: str, lvs: dict[str, LinguisticVariable])#

Bases: Proposition

A Antecedent of a fuzzy rule

Of the form ‘temperature IS hot’

get_cylindrical_extension(firing_strengths: dict[str, dict[str, float]]) → float#

Returns the cylindrical extension of a single antecedent. Also applies NOT if this is the case

Parameters:

firing_strengths – dict of firing strengths.

Returns:

cylindrical extension of the antecedent.

Return type:

cylindrical_extension

property name: str#

The name of the linguistic variable.

property negate: bool#

True if we should negate the antedecent

property term: LinguisticTerm#

The linguistic term of the proposition.

to_string() → str#

Returns a string representation of the proposition.

class fuzzycontroller.rule.propositions.Antecedents(antecedents: dict, lvs: dict[str, LinguisticVariable])#

Bases: object

Multiple Antecedents of a single fuzzy rule

Of the form ‘(temperature IS hot) and (headache IS high)’

get_cylindrical_extension(firing_strengths: dict[str, dict[str, float]]) → float or np.ndarray#

Get the cylindrical extension of the antecedents.

Parameters:

firing_strengths – dictionary of firing strengths. of the form {variable_name: {term_name: firing_strength}}

Returns:

cylindrical extension of the antecedents.

Return type:

cylindrical_extension

property single_antecedent: bool#

True if there is only one antecedent.

to_string()#

e.g. “temperature IS cold AND humidity IS high”

Returns:

string representation of the antecedents.

class fuzzycontroller.rule.propositions.Consequent(conq: str, lvs: dict[str, LinguisticVariable])#

Bases: Proposition

A Consequent of a fuzzy rule

compute_output_set(cylindrical_extension: float) → ndarray#

Computes the output set of the consequent.

Parameters:

cylindrical_extension – cylindrical extension of the antecedents.

Returns:

output set of the consequent.

Return type:

output_set

property name: str#

The name of the linguistic variable.

property term: LinguisticTerm#

The linguistic term of the proposition.

class fuzzycontroller.rule.propositions.Proposition#

Bases: ABC

An abstract class for any Proposition

A Proposition is defined as an Antecedent or Consequent, with only 1 linguistic term, i.e “temperature IS hot”.

name#

name of the linguistic variable (e.g. temperature).

term#

linguistic term (e.g hot).

abstract property name: str#

The name of the linguistic variable.

parse_proposition(prop: str, lvs: dict[str, LinguisticVariable]) → tuple[str, LinguisticTerm]#

Parses a proposition string into a linguistic variable and term.

Parameters:

  • prop – string representation of the proposition. ex. ‘linguistic_variable IS term’

  • lvs – dict of linguistic variables. Keys are the names of the linguistic variables.

Returns:

name of the linguistic variable. term: linguistic term.

Return type:

name

abstract property term: LinguisticTerm#

The linguistic term of the proposition.

to_string() → str#

Returns a string representation of the proposition.

fuzzycontroller.rule.rule#

class fuzzycontroller.rule.rule.Rule(rule: dict, linguistic_variables: dict[str, LinguisticVariable])#

Bases: object

A rule.

This is of the form: IF <antecedent> THEN <consequent>, where <antecedent> is an :class: .Antecedents and <consequent> is a :class: .Consequent.

antecedents#

antecedent of the rule.

consequent#

consequent of the rule.

apply_rule(firing_strengths: dict[str, dict[str, float]]) → np.ndarray#

Combines the firing strengths of the antecedents with respect to the rule. This output set is then computed.

Parameters:

firing_strengths – dictionary of firing strengths of the antecedents linguistic terms. The keys are the names of the linguistic variables and the values are dictionaries with the names of the linguistic terms as keys and the firing strengths as values.

Returns:

output set of the consequent.

Return type:

output_set

to_string() → str#

Returns a string representation of the rule.

fuzzycontroller.rule.rules#

class fuzzycontroller.rule.rules.Rules(rules: dict, linguistic_variables: dict[str, LinguisticVariable])#

Bases: object

Multiple rules for the whole system

Defined as multiple :class: .Rule objects.

output_sets#

dictionary of output sets of the rules. The keys are the name of the rule.

lvs#

dictionary of linguistic variables.

rules#

dictionary of rules. The keys are the name of the rule.

get_correct_output_sets(firing_strengths: dict[str, dict[str, float]])#

Calculates the correct output sets for the given firing strengths.

Parameters:

firing_strengths – dict of firing strengths for each linguistic term.

property output_sets: dict[str, np.ndarray]#

The output sets of the rules.

Raises:

AttributeError if the output sets have not been computed. –
